description: From Middle English prively; equivalent to privy +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: privily (comparative more privily, superlative most privily)

entries.meaning: (archaic) Secretly, in secret; in a private manner; privately.
examples: […]  to cause that foaming in their mouthes, which is fearefull to behold by the standers by, they have this trick, privily to convey a peece of white soape into one corner of their Jawes, which causeth that froth to come boyling forth.
